items.title: Mouat and Dodds get Team GB off to winning start

items.title: Notepad++ Users, You May Have Been Hacked by China

items.title: New triple-drug treatment stops pancreatic cancer in its tracks, a mouse study finds
items.summary: By targeting three key growth pathways at once, researchers eliminated pancreatic tumors in multiple mouse models and prevented the cancer from returning, a promising step toward overcoming treatment resistance.

items.title: Thousands of dams in the US are old, damaged and unable to cope with extreme weather. How bad is it?
items.summary: Dams in the U.S. are showing signs of damage that are worsening with age and climate change. Could satellites help prioritize repairs amid budget and inspection constraints?

items.title: 'Part of the evolutionary fabric of our societies': Same-sex sexual behavior in primates may be a survival strategy, study finds
items.summary: A new study comparing 59 species of primates linked same-sex sexual behavior to scarce resources and more predators in socially complex species. The findings show diverse sexual behaviors are common â€” and likely beneficial in primates.

items.title: More than 43,000 years ago, Neanderthals spent centuries collecting animal skulls in a cave; but archaeologists aren't sure why
items.summary: Neanderthals repeatedly returned to the cave to store horned animal skulls, revealing this cultural tradition was transmitted over time.

items.title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
items.summary: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
items.summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

items.title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
items.summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.
